meanings.definition: Relating to or derived from a foreign source.
meanings.sent1: The xenogenic spices in the dish gave it a unique flavor.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the xenogenic materials brought back from the expedition.
meanings.sent3: The xenogenic plants in the garden seemed to be whispering to each other.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was a xenogenic blend of traditional and modern styles.
meanings.sent5: The xenogenic landscape of the alien planet left the astronauts in awe.

meanings.definition: Produced or induced by a foreign substance or organism.
meanings.sent1: The xenogenic reaction caused by the medication surprised the doctors.
meanings.sent2: The xenogenic antibodies fought off the infection in the patient's body.
meanings.sent3: The xenogenic cells in the experiment started dancing under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: The xenogenic influence on the local culture was evident in their music.
meanings.sent5: The xenogenic growth in the lab was unlike anything they had seen before.
